attributes.action: Review and amend the Mental Health Act 1983.
attributes.background: As someone who has had a range of mental health conditions, I'm taking it upon myself to get legislation updated in line with today’s requirements and to ensure other victims are supported.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly, the Mental Health Act 1983 is a piece of legislation from nearly 36 years ago. Awareness, understanding and support has changed vastly in those years, so it's about time legislation did too. 
 
Secondly, some of the content of the act is simply degrading for victims and sufferers of this condition and other conditions similar to it. There are mentions in the Act to detain individuals experiencing or who have experienced an episode for 6 months. As matter of fact, this makes victims worse.

attributes.action: Cut the number of Councillors proposed to sit on new Buckinghamshire Council.
attributes.background: Following the decision to form a new Unitary Authority called ‘The Buckinghamshire Council’ it has been proposed that the new Council will be made up of 147 Councillors. We call for the number of proposed Councillors to this new Unitary authority to be set at a more realistic and efficient level.
attributes.additional_details:
This is substantially more than the current 49 Councillors who sit on Bucks County Council and significantly more than the 98 Councillors originally proposed for the new Council. 
There is no justification for this increase in the number of Councillors and the extra costs it will incur will mean that funds are taken away from vital public services in Buckinghamshire.

attributes.action: The UK to apply to join the Schengen Agreement
attributes.background: The Schengen Agreement guarantees border check-free travel for people within its member states. The UK should apply to join Schengen immediately to avoid travel disruption after Brexit. It's not necessary to be in the EU or EEA to join. Switzerland isn't a member of either, but is in Schengen.
attributes.additional_details: If the UK joins Schengen, there will be no more passport checks at Dover or Calais. People will be able to enter and leave the UK without any checks. This could hugely benefit the UK economy in terms of trade, open migration and tourism. It will also help the UK to develop a more humane policy towards asylum-seekers and refugees. If the UK joins Schengen, no-one will need to risk their life trying to cross the Channel by dinghy anymore.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum annual leave entitlement from 5.6 weeks to 7.6 weeks.
attributes.background:
The increasing retirement age leaves far less to look forward to at the end of our working lives. We are asking for increased minimum annual leave entitlements during our working lives to compensate for this loss.

This will give us more time with our families and to follow our own interests.
attributes.additional_details:
Retirement age is increasing (currently 67). Estimates are that when today's teenagers retire, the retirement age will be 75. People currently look forward to retirement but with increasing age there are fewer possibilities for those years.

Give us extra leave during our working years so that we can feel that we have lives and interests beyond work. It will reduce stress and exhaustion as well as increase happiness.

We will benefit, our children will benefit, our employers will benefit.

attributes.action: Make store return policies more flexible by law
attributes.background: Consumerism is unfair enough to us already, and hugely profitable companies should give us the benefit of the doubt when returning products.
attributes.additional_details: They should not refuse to refund resalable items on the basis that, without a receipt, it may have come from another store. Faith in humanity should be sufficient proof of purchase. Visibly unused products should not be doubted. Store credit is not an option. We need more lenient, flexible return policies.

attributes.action: Add Height and Weight as Protected Characteristics to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Height and weight discrimination are not even implemented under The Equality Act 2010, which is meant to be a law for everyone so that it "legally protects people from discrimination in the workplace and in wider society”, Gov.uk.
attributes.additional_details: Important protected characteristics such as age, race and sexual orientation, (all things that cannot be controlled), are included yet height and weight, (some medical conditions mean weight cannot be controlled, such as an underactive thyroid and Cushing's syndrome, NHS.uk), are ignored by our government. Is it fair that only some members of society are legally protected from being discriminated against?

attributes.action: Reopen the UK embassy in Damascus
attributes.background: After closing the embassy in 2011 due to the war, the British Government should now reopen their embassy in Damascus, the Syrian Capital, as the war draws to a close. Reopening the embassy and restoring ties with Syria could produce cooperation in regards to Islamist terror, and help rebuild Syria.
attributes.additional_details: The restoration of ties with Syria and the reopening of an embassy there would have significant benefits, both for Britain and the people of Syria. We have embassies in all neighbouring countries of Syria, including Iran, Saudi Arabia, and Iraq, and now that Damascus is safe and stable, it's time we restored the British Embassy. Trade, cooperation in regards to terrorism and ISIS, reconstruction, intelligence, and investment could thrive as a result. The British embassy in Syria should reopen.

attributes.action: All asylum seekers crossing the Channel be given the right to live in the UK
attributes.background: The UK has a proud history of tolerance, compassion and respect for human rights. Action must be taken to prevent a potential tragedy in the Channel. If asylum seekers are returned to France or elsewhere, they will simply try again to get to the UK. The problem will escalate unless stopped.
attributes.additional_details: If refugees attempt to cross the Channel by dinghy to get to the UK, then they should be intercepted, brought safely to the UK shore and automatically granted the right to live in the UK on humanitarian grounds. Once in the UK, all refugees and asylum seekers must be given the right to settle and be treated with dignity and respect. They must have provision to live in the community. There must be no use of immigration detention centres - fleeing war, genocide and persecution is not a crime.

attributes.action: Introduce anonymous Individual Voluntary Arrangements as law
attributes.background: At present time, if a personal is struggling with debt and want to enter an IVA it is presented on a formal register for as long as 6 years. This disadvantages the persons employment and housing opportunities. See https://www.iva-advice.co/pros-and-cons.html for background.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to release Sheikh Ibrahim Zakzaky from prison.
attributes.background:
Ibrahim Yaqoub El Zakzaky, is a Shia cleric who was arrested & imprisoned wrongfully in 2015  is still being detained despite the Federal High Court ordering his release on the 2nd of December 2016. 

As a result of his imprisonment, his health has deteriorated significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of his supporters have been either arrested, abused and even killed for protesting and calling for his release. 

The conditions in which Sheikh Zakzaky has been in are inhumane, and something needs to be done urgently to assist him.

attributes.action: Review how sexual assault victims are treated in court
attributes.background: Sexual assault victims often get ripped apart whilst giving evidence and trying to convict their rapist/the person who sexually assaulted them. This can often damage the victim’s mental health and force them not to come forward and report such things or drop out prior to court.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of sexual assaults are not reported, I believe this is due to the scary court process and being taken through something so horrific. The defence call these victims liars, sluts and retraumatise them all over again. Something needs to change as damaging and destroying a victim of such crime where there is enough evidence to suggest the suspect is guilty to get them off a charge is not the way forward.

attributes.action: HGVs restricted to first two lanes of motorways & be restricted at peak times.
attributes.background: HGVs, vehicles above 7.5 tonnes, cause restricted traffic flow when overtaking on motorways during busy periods.  HGVs should be restricted to the 1st lane during peak hours, using overhead signage, and should not be able to enter the third lane on four lane motorways.
attributes.additional_details: These restrictions are already in place all over the European motorway network and help traffic flow.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election in April 2019.
attributes.background: The UK populace deserves to have a people’s vote, on which UK Party, will lead us into the future. After we leave the European Union. Give people a choice on what party will take over after 29th March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the Conservative Party, should allow this. As they have made a bit of a catastrophe out of this whole Brexit ordeal. They owe us that much. Please allow an April 2019 - UK General Election.

attributes.action: Give under 18's free self-test STI kits
attributes.background: Self-test kits for STIs are also available online and on the high street. They include home testing kits for infections such as chlamydia and gonorrhoea that you can send away to a laboratory. This could be a huge help to the amount of people who are nervous or shy to go to such clinic to be tested.

attributes.action: Renegotiate the Brexit deal immediately in the event MPs vote against it
attributes.background: If MPs vote against the Brexit deal, the Government shall immediatley seek to negotiate an improved deal, including ensuring the U.K. will have a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario thereby honouring the leave vote and working to avoid a “no deal” scenario
attributes.additional_details: The referendum vote to leave is compromised by the inability of the U.K. to unilaterally leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario. In the highly likely event MPs vote against the deal the Government must commit to return to the EU to negotiate an improved deal, for example to amend the Withdrawal Agreement to create a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario and to reduce the Brexit bill; to be done immediatley and urgently after the vote

attributes.action: Individuals should pay half the amount of tax on overtime.
attributes.background:
In order to better your financial position and that of your family you should be able to pay only half the amount of tax on any hours worked as overtime compared to what you work as normal hours. 
This arrangement would encourage people into work and boost production and productivity for employers.

attributes.action: Simplify planning use classes by combine A1, A2, B1 and D1.
attributes.background: Planning requires change of use, which is expensive.  This is just red-tape.  Many categories overlaps.

attributes.action: Make it a law in the Porn industry all STD’s to be on sexual health certificates
attributes.background: I have worked in the Porn industry for the past 3 years and believe that sexual health is very important. On a sexual health certificate that we provide for Porn companies and performers in order to be able to work I believe should include every sexually transmitted infection instead of just some!
attributes.additional_details: In the Porn industry we are required to be tested every 28 days and have to provide a sexual health screening certificate to Porn companies and other performers in order to be able to work, how ever on the current certificates Porn companies and performers do not require all STD’s to be present on the certificate therefore people are still at risk of catching infections such as: Trichomoiasis, Herpes, Mycoplasma Genitalium and more! This is a big concern and I believe this should be a law.
